column4: how can i see what process is using buffer and cache  in memory?
Those areas aren't associated with particular processes
i see but something is filling my RAM .. and i want to know what it is
Um, yeah. Cache. This is a /good/ thing.
Memory that's marked as "free" might as well be marked as "burning power with no benefit to you"
i see but there is no reason for such an amount of uffers and cache the servers load is technicaly zero
Exactly
Cache is what linux used memory for if it can't figure out something better to do with it
And it /will/ fill all of memory if you let things run long enough. This is /good/. It means any disk reads that have happened before will be memory reads instead.
i understand but what is in that cache?
Stuff linux read from disk earlier
if i understand you right linux uses all free memory for disk cache?
Yes
is there a way to flush that?
Why would you want to?
to see how much memory i get freed
Um. Just count the "cache" tag in free as free memory.
Cache /is/ free memory, effectively. It can be dropped on the floor in a heartbeat, since the same data is on disk it can just be read back in at need.
Oh, and incidentally, any programs that still have an existence on disk run from cache. Remove the cache, and they'd have to read the executable back in.
i understand that :)
I doubt all of that 900MB is for cache
Run free. See what is what.
